H0.text: Space is limited for growth, which explains why large ecosystems take a long time to fully recover after a volcanic eruption.

H1.text: The quality of light is low, which explains why it takes a long time for large ecosystems to fully recover after a volcanic eruption.

H2.text: Soil must be created, which explains why large ecosystems take a long time to fully recover after a volcanic eruption.

H3.text: Minerals are destroyed, which explains why large ecosystems take a long time to fully recover after a volcanic eruption.

A4.text: It takes decades to several thousand years for a soil to develop a profile

A5.text: The development of a distinct B horizon marks the development of a soil or pedogenesis
